intro: Umbellularia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaf tanoak, is a deciduous tree native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length and have a smooth, dark green upper surface. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into spherical, woody fruits containing one or two seeds. Its bark is thick, furrowed, and ranges from gray to reddish-brown in color. Umbellularia parvifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
